metadata.title: CVE-2021-34552 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Pillow through 8.2.0 and PIL (aka Python Imaging Library) through 1.1.7allow an attacker to pass controlled parameters directly into a convertfunction to trigger a buffer overflow in Convert.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python-imaging-compat - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python3-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python3-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python3-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python3-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
python3-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm3').
